results.title: A synthesis on the sub-lethal toxicity of atenolol, a beta-blocker, in teleost fish.
results.text_hl: Data are lacking for behavioral responses to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@. Molecular biomarkers for @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ may include those associated with @<m>DISEASE_Acute_Kidney_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058186 @@@acute kidney injury@@@, @DISEASE_Cholestasis @DISEASE_MESH:D002779 @@@cholestasis@@@, and @DISEASE_Hypertriglyceridemia @DISEASE_MESH:D015228 @@@hypertriglyceridemia@@@.

citations.NLM: Ivantsova E, Martyniuk CJ. A synthesis on the sub-lethal toxicity of atenolol, a beta-blocker, in teleost fish. Environ Toxicol Pharmacol. 2023 Jul 20;():104236. PMID: 37481051

results.title: A Case of Life-threatening Amlodipine and Atenolol Overdose
results.text_hl: A Case of Life-threatening @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ Overdose

results.title: [Prolonged hypotension after the first dose of atenolol (author's transl)].
results.text_hl: A 30 year-old male @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ with accelerated @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Arterial_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000081029 @@@arterial hypertension@@@ relatively resistent to @CHEMICAL_Diazoxide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003981 @@@diazoxide@@@ received a single oral dose of 100 mg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, following which @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@ of more than 24 hours duration and @<m>DISEASE_Acute_Kidney_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058186 @@@acute renal failure@@@ ensued.

citations.NLM: Montoliu J, Botey A, Darnell A, Revert L. [Prolonged hypotension after the first dose of atenolol (author's transl)]. Med Clin (Barc). 1981 Apr 25;76(8):365-6. PMID: 7253756
citations.BibTeX: @article{7253756, title={[Prolonged hypotension after the first dose of atenolol (author's transl)].}, author={Montoliu J and Botey A and Darnell A and Revert L}, journal={Med Clin (Barc)}, volume={76}, number={8}, pages={365-6}}

results.title: Amlodipine poisoning revisited: Acidosis, acute kidney injury and acute respiratory distress syndrome
results.text_hl: Pertinently, doses of up to 1200 mg/day of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ have been reported to be well-tolerated without clinical manifestations.

citations.NLM: Naha K, Suryanarayana J, Aziz RA, Shastry BA. Amlodipine poisoning revisited: Acidosis, acute kidney injury and acute respiratory distress syndrome Indian J Crit Care Med. 2014 Jul;18(7):467-9. PMID: 25097362
citations.BibTeX: @article{25097362, title={Amlodipine poisoning revisited: Acidosis, acute kidney injury and acute respiratory distress syndrome}, author={Naha K and Suryanarayana J and Aziz RA and Shastry BA}, journal={Indian J Crit Care Med}, volume={18}, number={7}, pages={467-9}}

results.title: Effect of angiotensin II type 1 receptor blocker, candesartan, and beta 1 adrenoceptor blocker, atenolol, on brain damage in ischemic stroke.
results.text_hl: Neither @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ nor @CHEMICAL_candesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C081643 @@@candesartan@@@ caused significant change in MAP, SBP, DBP, PP and HR Conclusion . (1) @DISEASE_Cerebral_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D002544 @@@Ischemic stroke@@@ seems to be associated with a postischemic increase of the plasma @GENE_REN @GENE_24715 @@@renin@@@ secretion, which may increase the @DISEASE_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarct@@@ size in the brain and may induce @<m>DISEASE_Acute_Kidney_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058186 @@@acute renal insufficiency@@@. (2) This study confirms that @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ and ARBs could benefit @DISEASE_Cerebral_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D002544 @@@ischemic stroke@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ without altering blood pressure.

citations.NLM: Saad MA, Abbas AM, Boshra V, Elkhateeb M, El Aal IA. Effect of angiotensin II type 1 receptor blocker, candesartan, and beta 1 adrenoceptor blocker, atenolol, on brain damage in ischemic stroke. Acta Physiol Hung. 2010 Jun;97(2):159-71. PMID: 20511125
citations.BibTeX: @article{20511125, title={Effect of angiotensin II type 1 receptor blocker, candesartan, and beta 1 adrenoceptor blocker, atenolol, on brain damage in ischemic stroke.}, author={Saad MA and Abbas AM and Boshra V and Elkhateeb M and El Aal IA}, journal={Acta Physiol Hung}, volume={97}, number={2}, pages={159-71}}
